title: BPA exposure during pregnancy can alter circadian rhythms

title_detail.value: BPA exposure during pregnancy can alter circadian rhythms

summary: Exposure to the widely used chemical bisphenol A (BPA) during pregnancy, even at levels lower than the regulated 'safe' human exposure level, can lead to changes in circadian rhythms, according to a mice study. The researchers report these changes may be a contributing factor in hyperactivity seen in BPA-exposed mice.
